AI Agents

Autonomous AI agents are rapidly moving from research to widespread deployment, but this also opens new fault lines. The report identifies three pressing risks: catastrophic misuse, gradual human disempowerment, and workforce displacement. These capabilities can streamline business but also enable cyber-intrusions, lower barriers to dangerous attacks, and put employment and wage stability under pressure.

Key Concepts:

  • Catastrophic Misuse
  • Gradual Human Disempowerment
  • Workforce Displacement
  • Autonomous systems
  • Artificial intelligence
  • Oversight challenges
  • Exponential growth of AI capabilities
AI Autonomy Cybersecurity Workforce Displacement Level 4 reasoning neural activations super-capable systems LLM upgrades model evaluation
